trans-unit.source: Getting started with SQL Databases Data Sync
trans-unit.target: Getting started with SQL Databases Data Sync

trans-unit.source: This tutorial helps you get started with the Azure SQL Data Sync (Preview).
trans-unit.target: This tutorial helps you get started with the Azure SQL Data Sync (Preview).

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you learn the fundamentals of Azure SQL Data Sync using the Azure (Preview) portal.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you learn the fundamentals of Azure SQL Data Sync using the Azure (Preview) portal.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes minimal prior experience with SQL Server and Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes minimal prior experience with SQL Server and Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you create a hybrid (SQL Server and SQL Database instances) sync group fully configured and synchronizing on the schedule you set.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you create a hybrid (SQL Server and SQL Database instances) sync group fully configured and synchronizing on the schedule you set.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click SQL DATABASES in the left pane.
trans-unit.target: Click SQL DATABASES in the left pane.

trans-unit.source: Click SYNC at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click SYNC at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: When you click SYNC, a list appears showing the things you can add - New Sync Group and New Sync Agent.
trans-unit.target: When you click SYNC, a list appears showing the things you can add - New Sync Group and New Sync Agent.

trans-unit.source: To launch the New SQL Data Sync Agent wizard, click New Sync Agent.
trans-unit.target: To launch the New SQL Data Sync Agent wizard, click New Sync Agent.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't added an agent before, click download it here.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't added an agent before, click download it here.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Image1</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Image1</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This step is required only if you are going to have an on-premises SQL Server database included in your sync group.
trans-unit.target: This step is required only if you are going to have an on-premises SQL Server database included in your sync group.

trans-unit.source: You can skip to Step 4: Create a sync group if your sync group has only SQL Database instances.
trans-unit.target: You can skip to Step 4: Create a sync group if your sync group has only SQL Database instances.

trans-unit.source: Be sure that you have the following installed on the computer you install the Client Agent.
trans-unit.target: Be sure that you have the following installed on the computer you install the Client Agent.

trans-unit.source: .NET Framework 4.0
trans-unit.target: .NET Framework 4.0

trans-unit.source: You can install .NET Framework 4.0 from <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can install .NET Framework 4.0 from <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2 SP1 System CLR Types (x86)
trans-unit.target: Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2 SP1 System CLR Types (x86)

trans-unit.source: You can install the Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2 SP1 System CLR Types (x86) from <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: You can install the Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2 SP1 System CLR Types (x86) from <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2 SP1 Shared Management Objects (x86)
trans-unit.target: Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2 SP1 Shared Management Objects (x86)

trans-unit.source: You can install the Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2 SP1 Shared Management Objects (x86) from <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: You can install the Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2 SP1 Shared Management Objects (x86) from <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Follow the instruction at <linkText>Install a Client Agent (SQL Data Sync)</linkText><title></title> to install the agent.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instruction at <linkText>Install a Client Agent (SQL Data Sync)</linkText><title></title> to install the agent.

trans-unit.source: Return to the New SQL Data Sync Agent wizard.
trans-unit.target: Return to the New SQL Data Sync Agent wizard.

trans-unit.source: Give the agent a meaningful name.
trans-unit.target: Give the agent a meaningful name.

trans-unit.source: From the dropdown, select the REGION (data center) to host this agent.
trans-unit.target: From the dropdown, select the REGION (data center) to host this agent.

trans-unit.source: From the dropdown, select the SUBSCRIPTION to host this agent.
trans-unit.target: From the dropdown, select the SUBSCRIPTION to host this agent.

trans-unit.source: Click the right-arrow.
trans-unit.target: Click the right-arrow.

trans-unit.source: After the Client Agent is installed, register every on-premises SQL Server database that you intend to include in a sync group with the agent.
trans-unit.target: After the Client Agent is installed, register every on-premises SQL Server database that you intend to include in a sync group with the agent.

trans-unit.source: To register a database with the agent, follow the instructions at <linkText>Register a SQL Server Database with a Client Agent</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To register a database with the agent, follow the instructions at <linkText>Register a SQL Server Database with a Client Agent</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Return to the <linkText>Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Return to the <linkText>Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click SQL DATABASES.
trans-unit.target: Click SQL DATABASES.

trans-unit.source: Click ADD SYNC at the bottom of the page then select New Sync Group from the drawer.
trans-unit.target: Click ADD SYNC at the bottom of the page then select New Sync Group from the drawer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Image2</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Image2</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter a meaningful name for the sync group.
trans-unit.target: Enter a meaningful name for the sync group.

trans-unit.source: From the dropdown, select the REGION (Data Center) to host this sync group.
trans-unit.target: From the dropdown, select the REGION (Data Center) to host this sync group.

trans-unit.source: Click the right-arrow.
trans-unit.target: Click the right-arrow.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Image3</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Image3</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the dropdown, select the SQL Database instance to serve as the sync group hub.
trans-unit.target: From the dropdown, select the SQL Database instance to serve as the sync group hub.

trans-unit.source: Enter the credentials for this SQL Database instance - HUB USERNAME and HUB PASSWORD.
trans-unit.target: Enter the credentials for this SQL Database instance - HUB USERNAME and HUB PASSWORD.

trans-unit.source: Wait for SQL Data Sync to confirm the USERNAME and PASSWORD.
trans-unit.target: Wait for SQL Data Sync to confirm the USERNAME and PASSWORD.

trans-unit.source: A green check mark appears to the right of the PASSWORD when the credentials are confirmed.
trans-unit.target: A green check mark appears to the right of the PASSWORD when the credentials are confirmed.

trans-unit.source: From the dropdown, select the CONFLICT RESOLUTION policy.
trans-unit.target: From the dropdown, select the CONFLICT RESOLUTION policy.

trans-unit.source: Hub Wins - any change written to the hub database is written to the reference databases, overwriting changes in the same reference database record.
trans-unit.target: Hub Wins - any change written to the hub database is written to the reference databases, overwriting changes in the same reference database record.

trans-unit.source: Functionally, this means that the first change written to the hub is propagated to the other databases.
trans-unit.target: Functionally, this means that the first change written to the hub is propagated to the other databases.

trans-unit.source: Client Wins - changes written to the hub are overwritten by changes in reference databases.
trans-unit.target: Client Wins - changes written to the hub are overwritten by changes in reference databases.

trans-unit.source: Functionally, this means that the last change written to the hub is the one kept and propagated to the other databases.
trans-unit.target: Functionally, this means that the last change written to the hub is the one kept and propagated to the other databases.

trans-unit.source: Click the right-arrow.
trans-unit.target: Click the right-arrow.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Image4</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Image4</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Repeat this step for each additional database you want to add to the sync group.
trans-unit.target: Repeat this step for each additional database you want to add to the sync group.

trans-unit.source: From the dropdown, select the database to add.
trans-unit.target: From the dropdown, select the database to add.

trans-unit.source: Databases in the dropdown include both SQL Server databases that have been registered with the agent and SQL Database instances.
trans-unit.target: Databases in the dropdown include both SQL Server databases that have been registered with the agent and SQL Database instances.

trans-unit.source: Enter credentials for this database - USERNAME and PASSWORD.
trans-unit.target: Enter credentials for this database - USERNAME and PASSWORD.

trans-unit.source: From the dropdown, select the SYNC DIRECTION for this database.
trans-unit.target: From the dropdown, select the SYNC DIRECTION for this database.

trans-unit.source: Bi-directional - changes in the reference database are written to the hub database, and changes to the hub database are written to the reference database.
trans-unit.target: Bi-directional - changes in the reference database are written to the hub database, and changes to the hub database are written to the reference database.

trans-unit.source: Sync from the Hub - The database receives updates from the Hub.
trans-unit.target: Sync from the Hub - The database receives updates from the Hub.

trans-unit.source: It does not send changes to the Hub.
trans-unit.target: It does not send changes to the Hub.

trans-unit.source: Sync to the Hub - The database sends updates to the Hub.
trans-unit.target: Sync to the Hub - The database sends updates to the Hub.

trans-unit.source: Changes in the Hub are not written to this database.
trans-unit.target: Changes in the Hub are not written to this database.

trans-unit.source: To finish creating the sync group, click the check mark in the lower right of the wizard.
trans-unit.target: To finish creating the sync group, click the check mark in the lower right of the wizard.

trans-unit.source: Wait for the SQL Data Sync to confirm the credentials.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the SQL Data Sync to confirm the credentials.

trans-unit.source: A green check indicates that the credentials are confirmed.
trans-unit.target: A green check indicates that the credentials are confirmed.

trans-unit.source: Click the check mark a second time.
trans-unit.target: Click the check mark a second time.

trans-unit.source: This returns you to the SYNC page under SQL Databases.
trans-unit.target: This returns you to the SYNC page under SQL Databases.

trans-unit.source: This sync group is now listed with your other sync groups and agents.
trans-unit.target: This sync group is now listed with your other sync groups and agents.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Image5</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Image5</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Data Sync allows you to select tables and columns to synchronize.
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Data Sync allows you to select tables and columns to synchronize.

trans-unit.source: If you also want to filter a column so that only rows with specific values (such as, Age>=65) are synchronized, use the SQL Data Sync portal at Azure and the documentation at Select the Tables, Columns, and Rows to Synchronize to define the data to sync.
trans-unit.target: If you also want to filter a column so that only rows with specific values (such as, Age>=65) are synchronized, use the SQL Data Sync portal at Azure and the documentation at Select the Tables, Columns, and Rows to Synchronize to define the data to sync.

trans-unit.source: Return to the <linkText>Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Return to the <linkText>Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click SQL DATABASES.
trans-unit.target: Click SQL DATABASES.

trans-unit.source: Click the SYNC tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the SYNC tab.

trans-unit.source: Click the name of this sync group.
trans-unit.target: Click the name of this sync group.

trans-unit.source: Click the SYNC RULES tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the SYNC RULES tab.

trans-unit.source: Select the database you want to provide the sync group schema.
trans-unit.target: Select the database you want to provide the sync group schema.

trans-unit.source: Click the right-arrow.
trans-unit.target: Click the right-arrow.

trans-unit.source: Click REFRESH SCHEMA.
trans-unit.target: Click REFRESH SCHEMA.

trans-unit.source: For each table in the database, select the columns to include in the synchronizations.
trans-unit.target: For each table in the database, select the columns to include in the synchronizations.

trans-unit.source: Columns with unsupported data types cannot be selected.
trans-unit.target: Columns with unsupported data types cannot be selected.

trans-unit.source: If no columns in a table are selected, the table is not included in the sync group.
trans-unit.target: If no columns in a table are selected, the table is not included in the sync group.

trans-unit.source: To select/unselect all the tables, click SELECT at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: To select/unselect all the tables, click SELECT at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click SAVE, then wait for the sync group to finish provisioning.
trans-unit.target: Click SAVE, then wait for the sync group to finish provisioning.

trans-unit.source: To return to the Data Sync landing page, click the back-arrow in the upper left of the screen (above the sync group's name).
trans-unit.target: To return to the Data Sync landing page, click the back-arrow in the upper left of the screen (above the sync group's name).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Image6</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Image6</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can always synchronize a sync group by clicking SYNC at the bottom of the Data Sync landing page.
trans-unit.target: You can always synchronize a sync group by clicking SYNC at the bottom of the Data Sync landing page.

trans-unit.source: If you want a sync group to synchronize on a schedule, you configure the sync group.
trans-unit.target: If you want a sync group to synchronize on a schedule, you configure the sync group.

trans-unit.source: Return to the <linkText>Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Return to the <linkText>Management Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click SQL DATABASES.
trans-unit.target: Click SQL DATABASES.

trans-unit.source: Click the SYNC tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the SYNC tab.

trans-unit.source: Click the name of this sync group.
trans-unit.target: Click the name of this sync group.

trans-unit.source: Click the CONFIGURE tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the CONFIGURE tab.

trans-unit.source: AUTOMATIC SYNC
trans-unit.target: AUTOMATIC SYNC

trans-unit.source: To configure the sync group to sync on a set frequency, click ON.
trans-unit.target: To configure the sync group to sync on a set frequency, click ON.

trans-unit.source: You can still sync on demand by clicking SYNC.
trans-unit.target: You can still sync on demand by clicking SYNC.

trans-unit.source: Click OFF to configure the sync group to sync only when you click SYNC.
trans-unit.target: Click OFF to configure the sync group to sync only when you click SYNC.

trans-unit.source: SYNC FREQUENCY
trans-unit.target: SYNC FREQUENCY

trans-unit.source: If AUTOMATIC SYNC is ON, set the synchronization frequency.
trans-unit.target: If AUTOMATIC SYNC is ON, set the synchronization frequency.

trans-unit.source: The frequency must be between 5 Minutes and 1 Month.
trans-unit.target: The frequency must be between 5 Minutes and 1 Month.

trans-unit.source: Click SAVE.
trans-unit.target: Click SAVE.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Image7</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Image7</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Congratulations.
trans-unit.target: Congratulations.

trans-unit.source: You have created a sync group that includes both a SQL Database instance and a SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: You have created a sync group that includes both a SQL Database instance and a SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: For additional information on SQL Database and SQL Data Sync see:
trans-unit.target: For additional information on SQL Database and SQL Data Sync see:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SQL Data Sync content on MSDN Library</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SQL Data Sync content on MSDN Library</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SQL Database Overview</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SQL Database Overview</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Database Lifecycle Management</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Database Lifecycle Management</linkText><title></title>
